result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew L. Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>1000-2500 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED AND STAYED
If revoked, 11 days credit
If revoked, defendant shall pay court costs.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay court costs directly to Clerk of Courts.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such counseling as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall submit to random drug testing.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mathew L. Turner in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Mathew L. Turner.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant to plead to charge. State will remain silent as to sentence. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard on priors. Attorney Brehm heard and recommends probation with 9 months jail imposed and stayed. Defendant heard. Court orders 9 months jail with huber and court costs, imposed and stayed, 3 years probation with conditions: court costs, DNA, counseling, random drug testing. Credit of 11 days.

Defendant Mathew L. Turner in court.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Mathew L. Turner.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement will be accepted. Plea and sentencing date requested. Case removed from trial calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Anthony Pozorski appeared in court, Defendant appeared by video in custody from Grant County Jail, Attorney Philip Brehm appeared by phone. Defendant Mathew L. Turner appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Philip J. Brehm appeared in court for Mathew L. Court binds matter over. Information has been filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to the charge. Defendant is awaiting revocation proceedings. Status and trial weeks set.
